snippet: The university’s president said the protest that forced the cancellation of a speech by the New York City police commissioner, Raymond W. Kelly, violated the institution’s code of conduct.
abstract: Brown University plans to investigate protest that forced cancellation of speech by New York City Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly, and decide whether anyone should be disciplined; speech was disrupted by dozens of protesters shouting at Kelly and criticizing Police Department’s stop-and-frisk policies; university’s president, Christina H Paxon, says protest violated institution’s code of conduct.
lead_paragraph: The university’s president said the protest that forced the cancellation of a speech by the New York City police commissioner, Raymond W. Kelly, violated the institution’s code of conduct.

headline.main: Protest Over Kelly Is Focus of Inquiry, Brown University Says
headline.print_headline: Protest Over Kelly Is Focus of Inquiry, Brown U. Says
